name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Indianapolis Downtown

reviews.text: This hotel is part of the Marriott center in downtown Indianapolis. It is very convenient and nice. It is well priced compared to the other locations in downtown. The staff was extremely friendly. I had to complain that the guests next door was making too much noise for me to sleep and the manager immediately came up and fixed it. There is a TGIF in this hotel which is convenient for eating lunch and dinner because it never really gets very busy as it it out of the way unless staying at the hotel.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly

reviews.text: One of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. It's relatively new, of course, and that helps. But my king room was beautifully appointed and very well lit. The bathroom was fabulous! Spacious with good lighting and a beautiful glass door, tiled walk-in shower.
reviews.title: Wonderfully clean and nice place

reviews.text: The room is a bit small (not the bathroom part), but unless you're going to be spending hours and hours in it, it doesn't matter. Spotlessly clean from corners to shower. I was very impressed.
reviews.title: Excellent value for the Priceline bid

reviews.text: Very quiet. I was close to the elevators but never heard a peep from hallway or neighbors.
reviews.title: Terrible room, overpriced

reviews.text: From check in to check out, the staff was friendly, helpful and very responsive. Free breakfast was typical, but good and satisfactory offering something for every appetite.
reviews.title: Overall pleasant stay

reviews.text: I travel to Indianapolis on business twice a year, and I always try to stay at the Fairfield Inn. This hotel is a great value, and the location to all the restaurants and shopping is perfect. The hotel is very nice, with a great free breakfast and free coffee all day long. Next door is T.G.I. Friday if you don't want to go far to get something to eat. For me, the convention center is just a five minute walk. I have never had a bad stay, and the rooms are always very nice and everything you need.
reviews.title: Great price and location

reviews.text: There's not much more I can say about the Fairfield Inn & Suites. It was well priced at around $200 a night for a suite, connected to a TGIFridays, free continental breakfast, connected to JW Marriott (which you can utilize their facilitates and charge your room) and connected via walkways to JW and in turn, the rest of Indianapolis downtown.
reviews.title: Great location in Indianapolis

reviews.text: This was my first visit to Indianapolis, the front desk was very helpful in where I should go (all walkable) and eat. They were also very welcoming and kind when entering and leaving the building. I really couldn't have asked for a better experience.
reviews.title: Staying in Downtown Indy? You can do better if using Expedia or other pre-pay site. READ:

reviews.text: Hotel & parking were fine. Rooms extremely small but clean. Location is convenient to downtown locations.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC Stay all around

reviews.text: What I'm really posting about is the fact I booked through Expedia an the following is what awaits you: CANNOT change room category, CANNOT upgrade, CANNOT switch from King to (2) Doubles (even though other patrons who had a (2) Double room booked but wanted a King. ALL BECAUSE I booked through Expedia. I was willing to pay any surcharges but the Rep wouldn't hear it. Room we had MUST HAVE BEEN THE WORST LOCATED ROOM IN HOTEL...and all because I booked through Expedia??? Still paid $175 per night so to say the least I am not happy with the experience. Simply don't know why they were unable to even TRY and accommodate our request for different type lodging. Nothing against the Hotel condition or location, I simply like to be treated as GUEST no matter if I pay my hard earned money in person or online through a Travel site they obviously have an agreement with. Just my opinion but I will NOT Book a stay here unless its DIRECTLY through them.
reviews.title: Nice, well located place to stay

reviews.text: Second trip to the downtown Fairfield during a busy convention/competition/football weekend and our experience was excellent. Quiet rooms/hallways and attentive staff from all including valet, front desk and housekeeping. Convenient to convention center -- have to walk thru the parking garage (only a bit -- well lit and safe) and the JW (right past Starbucks). Room very clean, free breakfast (very busy but well stocked). Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Downtown Property

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for the first time on Tuesday, November 21 to Wednesday, November 22. Let me first say that the location is excellent if you need to be close to the State House. Secondly, from the arrival in the parking garage to check-out this was hands down my favorite place to stay in Indy. The garage is very clearly marked so that you know which entrance to use for which hotel. EXCELLENT! Secondly, check in was smooth, quick and the gentleman at the desk was courteous, friendly, and knowledgeable. The hotel was immaculate from the moment you step off the elevator from the garage. The halls, elevators in the hotel, and especially the rooms were extremely clean and smelled clean! I hope this is an everyday event because I am staying there again next Thursday evening. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to someone looking for a NICE, CLEAN, FRIENDLY hotel. This is the first time I have written such a raving review because it was definitely worth it. Thank you for a great experience. I look forward to many visits. Elise
reviews.title: Great price, friendly staff, all around excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was new so it was in good condition. Staff was very nice and helpful. Valet is a bit expensive but other parking is near. Perfect location for going out downtown, to Lucas Oil or the convention center. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced good location

reviews.text: This Fairfield Inn is in a cluster of other Marriott properties and seems to be the lower end of the group. We were there with a group for an event at Lucas Oil and this was perfect for being near the Convention Center and the stadium. You can walk all the way to the stadium without going outside - which would be great in cold weather. The hotel seems a bit older, but was very clean and filled all of our needs for a quiet place to stay and decent space. The service from the desk was outstanding. The breakfast (included) is your typical for Fairfield Inn, but was clean and seemed to always be filled and ready to go - even though the hotel seemed full when we were there. The TGI Friday's next door makes it easy to grab a quick meal. I would definitely stay here again if attending a downtown event.
reviews.title: Quick stop in Indy/Near Conv center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Indy for a weekend for a wedding in October. We decided to stay here because it was a little cheaper than the JW and we were all pleasantly surprised (3 rooms). We had a King suite and it was a good size and very clean. The bathroom was also clean and had a great walk-in shower. The shower doors could have used some scrubbing around the metal frame, but I understand how they can get like that, personally. The breakfast they put out was perfect with waffles, oatmeal, breakfast sandwiches, bagels, cereal, etc. We also enjoyed the free wi-fi and the TGI Friday's that was attached. We valeted our car because it was just a couple bucks more than self-parking. Parking fees are high, but no higher than in any other city we've stayed in. Our valet guy (forget his name) was really helpful and polite, kudos.
reviews.title: Great place in a great location

reviews.text: in town on biz - stayed at fairfield downtown. rooms are somewhat small but well appointed. clean - everything works, service is good. had a bed, had a desk, had a bathroom. if you need more than that then stay elsewhere - otherwise this place is fine. location is great, easy walking distance to circle center or other downtown places.
reviews.title: no frills - no problem

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights at this hotel. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean, the breakfast is good.
reviews.title: stay away from the sofa beds !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would rate this hotel 4 points instead of two if I hadn't slept in the sofa bed available in the room. We had to accomodate an extra guest, so we booked a room for three people with two double beds and a sofa bed.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend, great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no words to describe how uncomfortable was to sleep on this sofa bed !! I could feel *every* spring in the mattress core and there was no position I could stay that made me feel comfortable. I had to fold a blanket and place it under the sheet so that I could sleep.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay
Worked for us!
reviews.text: Unless you are a fakir, don't choose this hotel if you plan to use the sofa as a third bed.

aka: Fairfield Inn & Suites Indianapolis Downtown Hotel
description: The Fairfield Inn & Suites Indianapolis is adjacent to the Convention Center. Centrally located in the heart of this very walkable city, this hotel is close to Circle Center Mall, next to White River State Park, the Indianapolis Zoo, and several world-class museums. Also nearby are the Eiteljorg Museum, NCAA Hall of Champions, Lucas Oil Stadium, and Conseco Fieldhouse. This property features an on-site TGI Friday's, pillowtop mattresses, complimentary high-speed Internet Access, and breakfast.
